description: Unique ID for the user. SourcedId is used in other files and must be unique across all users,
“active” | “inactive” | “tobedeleted”. A tobedeleted object may be deleted in receiving systems if it already exists

SourcedIds of the Organizations to which this user belongs. If multiple Ids are required then use double quotes and separate with commas.(Note in most in cases, it is expected that users will belong to a single school).
external machine readable id (e.g. LDAP id, LTI id) for this user, to be used if the sourcedId should not be used.
User's middle name (s). If more than one then they are separated by a space.
Identifier for the user with a human readable meaning

SourcedIds of the users to which this user has a relationship. If multiple Ids are required then use double quotes and separate with commas.Note: In  most cases this will be for indicating parental relationships
Grade(s) for which a user with role 'student' is enrolled. The permitted vocabulary is from CEDS (Version 5) for the 'Entry Grade Level' element
The password for the user. This may or may not be an encrypted string. If encrypted the systems processing must be aware of the encryption method.
